thread.title: First USA Today college basketball poll released: Oklahoma a top-10 team; Baylor cracks the list
thread.title_full: First USA Today college basketball poll released: Oklahoma a top-10 team; Baylor cracks the list | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: First USA Today college basketball poll released: Oklahoma a top-10 team; Baylor cracks the list
text:
Oklahoma leads the charge of area men's college basketball teams ranked i nthe preseason USA Today poll, checking in at No. 8.
Baylor is the only other area team ranked (No. 21), though both Texas A&M and Texas are receiving votes.
SMU, which finished the 2014-15 regular season ranked No. 22, is nowhere to be seen after sanctions recently were passed down by the NCAA, banning the Mustangs from postseason play in the 2015-16 season.
Kansas (No. 5) is the highest ranked Big 12 team, while Iowa State (No. 7) and West Virginia (No. 23) also made the preseason poll.
The top 25 teams in the USA Today men's preseason college basketball poll, with first-place votes in parentheses, final 2014-15 records, points based on 25 points for a first-place vote through one point for a 25th-place vote and final 2014-15 ranking:
Team 2015 Record Pts Pvs. 1. North Carolina (12) 26-12 749 12 1. Kentucky (11) 38-1 749 3 3. Maryland (5) 28-7 723 16 4. Duke (3) 35-4 686 1 5. Kansas (1) 27-9 675 17 6. Virginia 30-4 667 8 7. Iowa State 25-9 541 19 8. Oklahoma 24-11 520 13 9. Villanova 33-3 498 9 10. Arizona 34-4 477 4 11. Gonzaga 35-3 468 6 12. Wichita State 30-5 461 11 13. Michigan State 27-12 386 7 14. California 18-15 350 - 15. Indiana 20-14 312 - 16. Utah 26-9 250 15 17. Wisconsin 36-4 181 2 18. Notre Dame 32-6 172 5 19. LSU 22-11 163 - 20. Vanderbilt 21-14 153 - 21. Baylor 24-10 145 21 22. Butler 23-11 132 23 23. West Virginia 25-10 125 18 24. Connecticut 20-15 110 - 24. Purdue 21-13 110 -
Others receiving votes: Michigan 108, Louisville 93, Texas A&M 58, UCLA 48, Georgetown 45, Cincinnati 43, North Carolina State 36, Oregon 33, Texas 29, Florida State 25, Xavier 25, Miami 11, San Diego State 10, Iowa 8, Boise State 5, Davidson 5, Providence 5, Belmont 2, Ohio State 2, Stephen F. Austin 2, Dayton 1, Marquette 1, Old Dominion 1, Tulsa 1.
